name: places/ChIJAQAwLuNYwokRDuYasTGmW38
adrFormatAddress: 830 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10022-7523, USA

originalText.text: We were on Shark Tank in 2021 and partnered with Product Launchers immediately even though we got a deal.  This was one of the best decisions we have made with our company.  We are represented to buyers of the best stores in our corner of the industry with such expertise and wisdom.  Each of them are timely, well spoken, and smart.  We trust Product Launchers to represent us while we do the hard work of making products.  This is an excellent partnership.  Highly recommend!

originalText.text: Working with "Product Launchers" is one of the best decisions that we've ever made as a start-up company. Their professional and pleasant services fully support us in getting into the luxury retailers to fulfilling D2C orders within 24~48 hours, customer service, moreover, our easy access to the team for any questions at any time until late at night!  You guys are simply amazing, and we deeply appreciate it so much.  What a way to partner up with a company like yours!

originalText.text:
I have worked with the CEO of Product Launchers for over a decade, even before she founded the company. The fact that Product Launchers has been in business for so long, with pretty much the same associates (and many of the same clients) for all these years, is a testament to the CEO. She is a genuinely nice person who truly cares about her clients and the associates that work with her. She feels it personally when something doesn't go as planned and does everything in her power to remedy it. I have seen her bend over backwards for clients and associates, including some who were abusive and tried to take advantage of her kindness.

Product Launchers chooses to work with only a limited number of clients so she can give them her full, personal attention, and only those products in which she believes will be successful. That's because her business model is such that Product Launchers profits only when clients profit. If a product doesn't make money, neither does Product Launchers.

originalText.text:
Tiny company is just a CEO and a few contractors. CEO will take money from clients any way possible without providing tangibly successful services.

Biggest problem is the CEO is absolutely 100% only focused on her profit yet launching young companies that are brand new. Doesn’t  even consider whether they are profitable.

CEO charges people HUGE FEES and gets them handcuffed in long legal contracts.

If you are a young business RUN!

I was told by the longest standing contractor that works for this company that the actual success rate of the products that go to this company is less than 2%!

CEO Has perfected getting money from young inexperienced inventors & companies until they are upside down like crazy.

If your wondering how small this company truly is versus what  she presents the company as I have a simple question...How many reviews do they have and what are the dates of the reviews versus my review? Note that my review is the first review for a "company" (1 Person Company) that has been in business for 10 years!

RUN!

originalText.text: We launched a new product and it sold out within 2 hours. Product Launchers was able to receive, fulfill, package and ship those orders that very same day. They are incredibly responsive and the overall level of efficiency they bring to our company is immeasurable.
